S.FORM: karetigir driya! sungal!
sinsi, inabayan!
katengadraw lra!
inabayan! garem i palaladam ku kanmu dra kemuda ta temarapuyuma marengay kana akanan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的南王卑南語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say food in Puyuma.

S.FORM: malradram yu kilrengaw kananku nirengayan?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi, adri ku malradram. karuwa yu masalr marengay?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: adri ku kilrengaw. karuwa yu kematrina driya?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: nauwi driya kadri! kurenangi ku emaip pariyasalr.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: inaba nu inaipan.
asalr driya maip. katrinayu driya.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: sasamengan! adri rarengay.
pupatraranu driya na tilin.
sinsi, aiwa!
pupatraranu driya na tratruri.
sinsi, abalu ku kemasu dra tratruri.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: pupatraranu driya na iyasaus.
sinsi, abalu ku kemasu dra iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kibulas driya kan tu iyasaus kana risarisan i saninin.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pabulasi ku driya dra iyasaus. maw?
talaulep ta lra.
ta palruwanay temakesi kadrini. marepanauwa ta driya an masalr liyusan.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: imanay yu?
i Uratr ku.
imanay yu?
tu walrak ku kan Maywan. i Sikaw ku ngalad.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Maywan, my name is Sikaw.

S.FORM: imanay yu?
tu temakakesi ku kan Senayan. i Semalaw ku ngalad.
S.TRANSL: I am a student of Senayan, and my name is Semalaw.

S.FORM: i manay nu ngalad?
i Masaw ku ngalad.
i manay tu ngalad kan temama?
i Malray tu ngalad kan namalri.
i manay taytaw?
i Kumeng taytaw.
i baelri na mainayan taytaw. i Kumeng tu ngalad.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Kumeng.

S.FORM: i manay tu ngalad?
i Kumeng tu ngalad.
i Malray tu ngalad?
aiwa! i Malray tu ngalad.
i Malray tu ngalad?
amelri, i Kumeng tu ngalad.
i manay idriyu na trau?
i Akunay taytaw. amau i mulri na babayan.
i manay idriyu na trau?
nanku anay taytaw. i Limuy tu ngalad.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Limuy。
She's a friend of mine, her name is Limuy.

S.FORM: munuma nu ami garem?
muketrep ku ami garem.
munuma tu ami garem?
muketrep misama dra druwaya tu ami garem.
munuma tu ami kan temama garem?
makalruwatr tu ami kan namalri garem.
miyasama mu maluwadiyadi?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: miyadruwa i baelri. misasa ku wadi.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: ulraya i bau na mainayan?
uniyan ku dra eba dra mainayan.
miyasama mu sarumaenan?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: miyapat mi sarumaenan.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: temakakesi yu isuwa?
temakakesi ku i Balangaw.
i manay taytaw?
i mulri na mainayan taytaw.
kiyakarun dra manay i temuu na mainayan?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: a kinsas taytaw.
i manay idriyu na trau?
i baelri na babayan taytaw.
kiyakarun i kiyaputremelan taytaw.
a maluwadi nadru na miyadruwa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: amelri! a mareali nadrunu.
a Inanuwayan yu?
aiwa! a Pinuyumayan ku.
a Inanuwayan nu kataguwin?
aiwa! amawna, a amis taytaw.
asatr i temama?
aiwa! aasatran mi sarumaenan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: temakesi lra nu wadi na babayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: aiwa! temakesi lra taytaw.
saigu temarapuyuma nu wawadiyan?
S.TRANSL: 你的弟妹會說南王卑南族語嗎?
Do your siblings speak Nam Wang Puy Nam?

S.FORM: aiwa! saigu temarapuyuma nadrunu.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: miyasama nu wawadiyan?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: miyatelu ku wawadiyan.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: marenang yu kanu maidrangan kikadru?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: aiwa! marenang ku kanku maidrangan kikadru.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: marenang yu kan temuu kikadru?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: adri! adri ku marenang kanadru kikadru.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: marenang yu kan manay kikadru?
marenang ku kan namalri、 nanalri kay baelri na mainayan kikadru.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: kemay isuwa nu kawang?
kemay ku i Takaw.
ulraya isuwa mu ruma?
i Balangaw nanku kaadruwan.
ulraya isuwa nu kaadruwan?
i Balangaw nanku kaadruwan.
ulraya isuwa nanmu drekalr?
ulraya i Puyuma naniyam drekalr.
S.TRANSL: Our tribe is in [Hualien]. *[Hualien] is freely interchangeable with other places.

S.FORM: uwaruma yu kan asuwa i drekalr?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: an semasede dra kadenunan i, muruma ku dar.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: tu lralrak ku dra Pinuyumayan
kemuda na wari garem?
mupatraran lra na kadaw. salaw bias na wari.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: kalralritek i patraran?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: salaw lritek. pikiruwan dra sadru.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: kababias i patraran?
adri! baliyan lra! salaw ayaw.
kemuda na wari garem?
adri lritek aw adri bias garem. salaw inaba.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari garem kana rauban?
uniyan dra kutrem i langitr. mupatraran lra na triur.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari i patraran?
madranga a garemay na udalr. kemadaw i, mupatraran na riwanes.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: kemuda na wari kadrunu?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: matrina na bali kadrini.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: inaba na wari kadrunu?
inaba! kemakadaw!
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: auka ku lra i takesian.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: lritek na wari, pikiruwan dra sadru.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: uwapatraran ku lra.
kapakireb na udalr an garemay. adri kababalu kemasu dra kalipang.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: kaaudalr?
dremerung a garemay. kaaudalr an garemay maku.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: maaudalr lra?
maudalr a garemay. madanga lra na udalr garem.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: maaudalr lra?
kamawan dra inudalran lra. daleken na dalan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: maaudalr? daw luenuenus yu?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: maaudalr i patraran. adri ku kemasu dra kalipang.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: inaba yu driya?
matrina na bali, besebesay ku aw batring ku.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: inaba yu driya?
matrina na kadaw. kurekakadaw ku aw malupaw ku.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: abalu ku kemasu dra tratruri.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: ti pabulasay yu.
abalu ku kemasu dra tratringal.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: kuyku i adri ku kemasu. kayta tremimaa.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: kayta tremimaa dra tratruri maw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: aiwa! tratrima ku driya dra iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: kayta tremimaa dra kakenamaan maw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: aeman! mekan ku lra i ruma.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: abalu ku benias dra tabu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kamelamu muka beniasa!
abalu ku kemasu dra tabu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: an kemadru i, ta ukasayay mekan ku tabu i!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: aekan yu dra manay an karealriyan?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: aekan ku i takesian kana pakasaseber na akanan.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: aekan yu dra manay an karealriyan?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: kemasu ku dra tabu garem. mukasaya ta mekan an karealriyan maw!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: kayta malinaya dra mali maw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: aiwa! alra!
kayta tremepuka dra mali maw?
aeman! nanau ku dra tilin.
alakan ku driya dra saselrap.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: aiwa! niya idri na saselrap.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: alakan ku driya dra trapul dra aitrulan maw?
S.TRANSL: Can you get me a rag, please?

S.FORM: semasaselrap ku. alakan ku kayu i Alaw.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Alaw to carry it for you.

S.FORM: piya yu lra semelrap?
piya ku lra semelrap.
daw adri yu semaselrap?
piya ku lra semelrap.
miyakitral na papadraran. uwa driya itruli.
S.TRANSL: The table is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: aiwa! kayku malaka dra trapulr dra aitrul.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: miyakitral idriyu na lataw. uwa itruli driya.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: garemay lra. adri ku driya peniya semelrap kadrini.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: kakuda yu an garemay?
auka ku mayaa kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: an muruma yu kemay i takesian i, kakuda yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: parenang ku kanku alian muka semenaya.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: an muruma kemay i takesian taytaw i, kakuda taytaw dra manay?
auka melranguya taytaw.
kiyumalra ku driya! ulraya i Apin i ruma?
ulraya i ruma taytaw. alamu usabak!
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: kiyumalra ku driya! ulraya i Agam i ruma?
uniyan taytaw! daw maya yu kantaw?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: i manay?
mumu, i Pidur ku. tratruwalri driya na alreban.
S.TRANSL: Grandfather, I am Pidru, please open the door.

S.FORM: i manay yu?
Senayan, i Pidur ku! druwa ku mayaa kanu malinaya.
S.TRANSL: Senayan, I'm Pidur and I've come to play with you.

S.FORM: paetreng ta lra adri marepanau.
aiwa! masupeng ku kanu. alamu! sadru ta padradrayaran.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來!我們好多話要聊!
Yeah! I've missed you. Come on! We have so much to talk about!

S.FORM: katengadraw driya! trekel driya dra kulisepa!
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: semangalan!
trekel driya dra kulisepa!
iuwa dra demalreulreu mu kulisepa iy!
mekana ta driya dra kalimudan.
aiwa! kadalreulreu an menau ta kandri na kalimudan!
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來好像很甜。
Wow! These fruits seem to be very sweet.

S.FORM: dalreu na kalimudan?
aiwa! salaw dalreu.
peniya lra maresiyuk dra kakerabian i ina. alamu mekana ta!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: aiwa! semabesaba ku driya dra lima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: kabetreker mekan. amelri yu a sidrumayan maku.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

S.FORM: sadru lra ku inekanan. betreker ku lra.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: kasadruyu mekan. adri kiyagela.
aiwa! salaw imaran.
uwaburek ku lra. an miwari ku i, druwaya ku driya menauwa kanu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: aiwa! marepanauwa ta driya!
aremeng lra! uwaburek ku lra.
an miwari yu i, alamu driya uwadrangi maw!
S.TRANSL: Come back to play again sometime!

S.FORM: taranapaw i dalan!
aiwa! an miwari yu alamu uwadrangi kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: inabayan! papilrang ku kanmu muka kirepanauwa dra maaidrangan i drekalr an uninan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: aiwa! tarapuyuma mi kimadrayar kana maaidrangan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說南王卑南族語。
Okay! We’re going to speak Southern King Puyuma to the seniors.

S.FORM: adalrep ta lra meredek?
adalrep lra.
mumu! druwa mi kirepanauwa kanu!
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: iuwa! saigu mu temarapuyuma i! salaw inaba i!
S.TRANSL: 哇!你們會說南王卑南族語啊!真是太棒了!
Wow! You guys speak Southern King Puyuma! That’s awesome!

S.FORM: inabayan! an uninan i, papilrang ku kanmu muka kikaruna i dawadawa.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: sinsi, aiwa!
alamu kadrini uturik. adri kababalu kemasu dra sinadaday.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: sinsi, aiwa! padangaw lra naniyam sinadaday.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: meredek ta lra?
adri driya! adawilr driya!
uwa puenay!
aiwa! puenaya ku!
uwa alak kana trapetrapan yuyu.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: aiwa! benawia ku dra ayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: inabayan! an uninan i, auka ta dra tu kinadruwan kana garamegaman.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: iuwa dra inaba i! kuwadakuda ta muka?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: muisatra ta dra bas.
uturik kadri peniya! tremimaa ta dra ritus.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: aiwa!
kadri nguwayan i, a ayaayam. kadri likudran i, a unaunan. karananetayan menau.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: sinsi, inedang ku dra unan.
an kemadrini i, uwa yuyu nau dra ayam.
S.TRANSL: 如果是這樣，那你去看鳥。
If that’s the case, then you go and see the birds.

S.FORM: an saya waluwan i, karebeliyas maradruka ta.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: aiwa! sinsi, semangalan!
menau yu dra manay kandri na wari?
menau ku dra sadru dra unan aw dra sadru dra ayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: kamelamu! uwaburek ta lra!
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: ngarayu ku driya! rapi ku dapalr.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: marenanga ta muka melranguya maw?
aiwa! alra!
sadru a trau na melralranguy kadrini.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: asabak na enay kadriyu. melranguya ta kadrini.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: kemuda yu druwa?
kemakawang ku druwa.
muisatr yu dra manay druwa?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: muisatr ku dra bas druwa.
kemuda yu muka i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: pakakawang dra palidring puisatr kanku i namalri.
kana wawariwari i, kemuda muka i takesian taytaw?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: muisatr kana ciyē-yun muka i takesian taytaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: kemuda muka tremimaa dra kulang i temumu na babayan?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: miutubay taytaw muka tremimaa dra kulang.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: kakuda yu muka i Butrulr?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uwaisatr ku dra tamina muka i Butrulr.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: kakuda muka i Butrulr taytaw?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: muisatr dra hikuki muka i Butrulr taytaw.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: muisatr dra manay taytaw muka i Takaw?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: muisatr kana pakesup na igiw muka i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: a muisatr dra igiw muka i Balangaw taytaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: aiwa! muisatr dra igiw muka i Balangaw taytaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: a muisatr dra igiw muka i Balangaw taytaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: amelri! muisatr dra hikuki muka i Balangaw taytaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: ulraya a uwaisatran dra bas kadrini?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: ulraya! munguwayayan ta kemakawang i, nanau yu dra uwaisatran dra bas.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: ulraya isuwa na maraadalredalrep kadrini na ciyē-yun-can?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: uniyan dra ciyē-yun-can kadrini. mawmau karuwa yu muisatr dra ki-ting-siya.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: muisatr dra bas karuwa munuma waluwan raredek i takesian?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: muketrep misama dra lruwatra trektrek raredek i takesian.
muisatr kana pakesup na igiw karuwa munuma waluwan raredek i Tay-cong?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: saya waluwan raredek i Tay-cong.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: pakakawang dra palidring muka i U-lay i, kapaetreng?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: karuwa saya waluwan.
karuwa munuma waluwan an muisatr yu dra ciyē-yun druwa kaniyam ruma?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: karuwa makabetraan trektrek.
saigu yu muisatr dra didinsiya?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: saigu ku muisatr dra didinsiya.
ulraya nu utubay?
ulraya ku utubay a saya.
ulraya nu utubay?
uniyan ku dra utubay.
karuwa ku muka kirepanauwa kanu nay?
emdaamaw! salaw ku semangal!
karuwa ku muka kiyumalra dra manay driyan kanu nay?
aeman! adri sadru ku kinalradraman.
S.TRANSL: Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: piyawari yu an mukidrayayan na kadaw? maranger ku muka kirepanauwa kanu. wawai yu nay?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: aiwa! ti ngarayaw yu i ruma.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: piyawari yu an daman? maranger ku kiyumalr kanu dratu batibatiyan dra Pinuyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於卑南族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the Peinan legend.

S.FORM: auka ku i drenan an daman. uniyan ku i ruma.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: ku kinilrengawan i, malradram yu dratu kakuwayanan kana Pinuyumayan kema. maranger ku kipaladam kanu driya.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對卑南族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Peinan people and I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: adri sadru nanku kinalradraman. amawna, pakirungetra ku temuban.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: kiyumalra ku driya! karuwa ku semasing pasirep kanu ngai nay? likudran i, ta kalralreayan temililr emapetr.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: aiwa! ta kuwadruwaw i!
kiyumalra ku driya! munuma lra nu ami garem?
makaiwa misama dra waluwa ku ami lra.
lralrak an menau ta kanu.
a lralrak dra manay. maidrang ku lra.
kiyumalra ku driya! kemay yu isuwa?
kemay ku i Puyuma.
S.TRANSL: 我來自普悠瑪(南王部落)。
I'm from the Puyuma (Southern King tribe).

S.FORM: kiyumalra ku driya! nu kataguwin i, amau a Pinuyumayan?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是卑南族人嗎?
Is your wife also a Puyuma?

S.FORM: amelri! a Payrang taytaw.
amanamanay ngaiyan nu kinasaiguan marengay?
saigu ku temaraamis aw temarapuyuma.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: salaw ku semangal draku iyadruwa kirepanauwa kanu garem. babati driya dratu lregiyan dra paaalrup maw?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: aiwa! a lralrak ku driya i, marayas ku muka i drenan paalrupa.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: semangalan! nu pinaladaman garem i, salaw inaba.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: panaan nanku nirengayan. amau tu batibatiyan dra temuwamuwan.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: ta palruwanay kadrini ta pinadrayaran garem. semangalan dranu pinaladaman.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: adri kiyagela! madrayadrayara ta driya.
uwaburek ku lra! an masalr lra i, kilrengawa ta driya dra sadru dra batibatiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: aiwa! tawar lra maw!
inabayan! tratrima yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra saya dra takilr.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: inabayan! tratrima yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra saya dra kabung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra takilr. menaniwan mu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: ulraya! tratrima yu dra munuma?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: menaniwan mu dra puran?
uniyan! adri mi menaniwan dra puran.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra beras.
tratrima yu dra munuma liputr?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: berayi ku dra teluwa liputr.
tratrima ku dra bunga.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: muniwan lra peniya na bunga.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra imar dra druwaya dalilran.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: musama lra a saya dalilran.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: uwa trimaan ku dra bitrenun.
tratrima yu dra munuma tintin?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: munuma tintin nu tratrimaan na bitrenun?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra druwaya tintin.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra druwaya tenges dra kenaw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: musama lra a teluwa tenges kadri. berayanay kanu peniya a!
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: idri na saliputr na beras i, munuma paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: druwaya leman paisu na saliputr.
mukasa i, makabetraan misama dra saya paisu. pukayane lra kana makabetraan paisu i.
semangalan!
makaiwa misama dra lruwatra paisu kadrini.
tremimaa ku driya dra saima. patelruaw dra saya leman paisu.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: lruwatra leman misama dra muketrep paisu peniya.
pukayane lra kana lruwatra leman paisu maw?
padrangal lra dradru idrini. karuwa kemadulu dra saima driya?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: adri karuwa! madulu lra idrini a!
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了!
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: aalak ku kandri na walru.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: makatelun paisu idri na walru. ulraya driya a manay nu aalakan?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: karuwa ku kibulas dra paisu kanu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: daamaw! kiyabulas yu dra munuma?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: abalu ku kemasu dra paisu. karuwa ku kibulas dra paisu kanu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: adri ku kemasu dra paisu i!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: abalu ku kemasu dra paisu. karuwa ku kibulas dra paisu kanu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: aeman! adaman nu kinibulasan na paisu i, adri yu driya parebeliyas kanku.
S.TRANSL: 不要!上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: karuwa ku kibulas kanu kiping?
aiwa! uwa alak yuyu.
karuwa ku kibulas kanu tilin?
ku pabulasanay kan Senten lra.
pabulasi ku driya kanu didinsiya maw?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: aiwa! amawna, parebeliyasu kanku an daman.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: maaudalr lra! adri ku kemasu dra kalipang. pabulasi ku dra kalipang maw?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: maumau saya ku kalipang. mukasaya ta mikalipan maw!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: idri na tilin amau nu pinabulas kanku a daman. parebeliyasaw kanu.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: an maranger yu driya menau dra druma dra tilin i, rengayu ku.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: parebelaliyas ku kanu dra paisu an asuwa?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: driyama lra! kiangeru lra an mipaisu yu.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: parebelaliyas yu kanku dra paisu an asuwa?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: ti parebeliyasay yu an daman.
S.TRANSL: I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: parebelaliyas yu an asuwa kanku tilin?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: ku parebeliyasay yu lra a daman maku?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: idri na tratruri tu pinabulas kanu kan Uratr maku?
S.TRANSL: Did Uratr lend you this pen?

S.FORM: aiwa! ku kinibulas a uninan kantaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: idri na tratruri nu kinibulas kan Alaw maku?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Alaw?

S.FORM: amelri! tu trinima kan ina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: uniyan lra dra ateri. uwa kibulas kan Senten dra saima dra ateri.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, let's go borrow some salt from Senten.

S.FORM: aiwa! kayku kibulasa.
parebeliyasu ku paisu kayu i Aden.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Aden to give me my money back.

S.FORM: mikiyan kanu dra munuma paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: auka yu isuwa?
auka ku i bakabak semalema dra kulang.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: makakuda yu?
tralutralun aw merarabi ku dra tralun. a puwaenayan lra an garemay.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: alakan ku driya dra kawkaw aw dra pitaw maw?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: nu retraanay isuwa?
niretra i saninin kana kangkang.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: nu kangkangaw lra na dare?
ku kangkangaw lra na dare a garemay. a puwabinian lra an garemay.
S.TRANSL: 我剛犁過土，等等要播種。
I've just ploughed the soil, and I'm going to sow the seeds.

S.FORM: nu sinaleman na kulang i, kararuwayan lra kiyakulang?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: na buaw kadrini i, karuwa lra kiyabuawan. na kadumu kadriyu i, adri driya karuwa kikadumu.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的樹豆可以收成了，那裡的玉米就還不能收成。
The beans here are ready for harvesting, but the corn there is not yet ready.

S.FORM: iuwa dra sadru nu kinerutran na bunga.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: pulrangi ku benekelr i kubaw maw?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me stack the barn?

S.FORM: makakuda mu?
temababukulr mi dra kuraw.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: sadru a kuraw kadrini?
sadru lra a kuraw i buebu.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經有很多魚了。
The fish traps are already full of fish.

S.FORM: kemuda yu dar kikuraw?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: ku panaaw dra kutang na kuraw.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: mipapana yu dar muka paalrupa?
S.TRANSL: Do you hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: mipetrir ku dar muka penetrira. an numa i, mikuwang ku aw pilrangaw na suwan paalrup.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用鐡夾抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with steel clips, but occasionally I'll hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: tu dalan kana babuy idrini.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: daw malradram yu?
tu dinapalran dra babuy idrini. driyama amau tu kinalrangan dra babuy.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: kayta melikapa drata petrir. kamawan dra mitiyu lra.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的鐡夾，好像抓到獵物了。
Let's go check our iron clips, it looks like we've caught our prey.

S.FORM: daw malradram yu?
kamawan dra tremaulr dratu bali na suwan. kamelamu ta kurenangay.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: semasanga yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: a sinanga dra batulrayaw idri na petrir. a papetriran dra kulabaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是鋼鐡做的夾子，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a clip made of steel and iron, used to catch mice.

S.FORM: amanay nu niretraan kadriyu?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: idri i, amau na petrir na sawawail dra dapalr. a dradrimutran dra ura.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: semangalan dra tu iyaberay dra temuwamuwan. salaw kalruba ta pinaalrupan garem.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: aiwa! ta kasuwaw muruma i drekalr aw marepaninia ta!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: an uninan i, palaladam ku kanemu dra kemudakuda ta temarapuyuma marengay kana “garamgaman”.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的卑南語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in puyuma language today.

S.FORM: an uninan i, palaladam ku kanemu dra kemudakuda ta temarapuyuma marengay kana “semaseberan”.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的卑南語怎麼說。

S.FORM: an uninan i, palaladam ku kanemu dra kemudakuda ta temarapuyuma marengay kana “kalimudan”.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的卑南語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in puyuma language today.

S.FORM: adri kallallupe!
sameng!
adri aekan dra manay driya!
pupatraranu nu tilin!
pupatraranu nu tratruri!
pupatraranu nu tatilillan!
apetru na tilin!
apetru na tratruri!
apetru na aekanan!
apetru na kalalinayan!
nantaw kan manay idri na tratruri?
amau nanku.
nantaw kan manay idri na tilin?
nantaw kan Bingki.
nantaw kan manay idri na iyasaus?
maulid ku.
nantu kiping kan Kamayti idru?
amelli. nantu patratreell kan Panay.
sinsi, adri ku kemasu dra tilin.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: ukasa kanu risarisan i saninin menau!
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: mutrikel lla ku tratruri.
piyuēncepi temilill.
uniyan lla ku iyasaus.
ti pabulasay yu kananku iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: talaulep ta lla temakesi. taranapaw i dalan an muwaruma mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心！
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: aiwa. sinsi, semangalan!
talaulep ta lla temakesi. marepanauwa ta driya!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見！
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: sinsi, marepanauwa ta driya!
inabayan! i Semalaw ku ngalad.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Semalaw.

S.FORM: Semalaw, inabayan!
inabayan! i Tugi ku ngalad.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Tugi.

S.FORM: Tugi, inabayan!
inabayan! i Semalaw ku.
Semalaw, inabayan! i Giwat ku.
inabayan! i Sulikang ku.
Sulikang, inabayan! i Giwat ku.
i manay yu?
i tinataw ku kan Ising. i Tiwa ku.
i manay yu?
tu wadi ku kan Ising. i Kimmay ku ngalad.
S.TRANSL: 我是Ising的妹妹，我的名字是Kimmay。
I am Ising’s sister. My name is Kimmay.

S.FORM: i manay taytaw?
nanku sinsi taytaw. i Hulun tu ngalad.
i manay idriyu na trau?
i baelli na mainayan. i Kisaw tu ngalad.
i Semalaw taytaw?
aiwa, i Semalaw taytaw.
i Semalaw yu?
amelli. i Giwat ku.
i manay i Semalaw?
i Semalaw ku.
i manay i Giwat?
i alielli i Giwat.
i manay tu ngalan kan bau na babayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: i Apeng tu ngalan kan baelli na babayan.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Apeng.

S.FORM: i manay tu ngalan kanu wadi na babayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: i Pipis tu ngalan kanku wadi na babayan.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Pipis.

S.FORM: malladram yu kantu ngalad?
i Semalaw tu ngalad.
munuma tu ami kan bau na mainayan garem?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: muketrep miasma dra lruwatra tu ami garem.
munuma lla tu ami kanu wadi na mainayan garem?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: kallalluwatr lla tu ami garem.
ullaya a takesian kanemu drekall?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: ullaya.
temakesi yu kanemu drekall na takesian?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎？
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: aiwa, an kadru mi i takesian temakesi i, kamawan mi dra sarumaenan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: i manay idriyu na mainayan?
i namalli na maranak.
i manay idriyu na babayan?
i baelli na babayan.
i manay idriyu na wallak?
ku wadi na mainayan.
kiyakarun dra manay i taina?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作？

S.FORM: a hitay i nanalli.
kiyakarun dra manay i temama?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作？

S.FORM: a sinsi i namalli.
nu wadi na mainayan taytaw?
amelli, tu alialian kanku wadi na mainayan taytaw.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: i bau na babayan taytaw?
amelli, ku wadi na babayan taytaw.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: miyasama nadru na sarumaenan?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: miyalluwatr nadru na sarumaenan.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: miyasama a wallak kanemu?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: miyapat a wallak kaniyam.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: miyasama nu wadi?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: uniyan ku dra wadi dra mainayan. ullaya a miyatelu ku wadi na babayan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: miyasama na bau?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: uniyan ku dra baebaan.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: miyasama nu wawadiyan?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: uniyan ku dra wawadiyan.
a maluwadi mu?
aiwa, i baelli na mainayan taytaw.
a Yuēn-cu-min mu?
aiwa, a Yuēn-cu-min mi.
a Pinuyumayan taytaw?
aiwa, a Pinuyumayan taytaw.
kemudakuda na wari garem?
parullitek na wari garem. treketrekel dra bias dra enay.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: kemudakuda na wari garem?
parubias na wari garem. treketrekel dra enay.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: kemudakuda na wari i patraran?
panana na kadaw. adri kaabalu penadang kana patatalaan dra kadaw.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: kemudakuda na wari i patraran?
kemutrekutrem. adri kemadaw.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: kuwadakuda na wari an daman?
adri kakadaw an daman. kakutrem aw kapakakireb a bali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: kuwadakuda na wari an adrunu?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: parullitek kandri na wari. pikiruwan dra patratreell an uwapatraran yu.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: kemudakuda na wari a kasedean?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: inaba na wari a kasedean.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: kaaudall na wari an adru?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: kainanaba na wari an adru. adri kaaudall.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: kaaudall na wari an adru?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: aiwa, kaaudall na wari an adru.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: maaudall garem?
madranga lla na udall. mupatraran lla na kadaw.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: maaudall garem?
maudall lla. adri ku kemasu dra kalipang.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: maaudall i patraran?
adri maudall garem. an paelipas dra karealliyan i, kaaudall. kasu lla dra kalipang an uwapatraran yu.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: kallallitek na wari an mariami?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: aiwa, kallallitek na wari an mariami. pikiruwan lla dra sadeku.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: kababias na wari kandri na kadenunan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: aiwa, kababias na wari kandri na kadenunan. treketrekel lla dra enay.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: sagar yu an kaseberan?
aiwa, sagar ku an kaseberan. sadeku na wari.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: sagar yu an kapuluan?
adri ku sagar an kapuluan. ullaya a bariwan an kapuluan dar.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天會有颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: abalu ku kemasu dra tilin.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: mukasaya ta menau.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: abalu ku kemasu dra iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: ti pabulasay yu.
abalu yu kemasu dra tratruri?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: aiwa, pabulasi ku dra tratruri maw?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: kareaalli yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: kareaalli ku dra mēn-paw.
kakerarabi yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: kakerarabi ku dra tinallek.
kenama yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: kenama ku dra bitrenun.
karealli yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: karealli ku dratu patraka dra terekuk.
kayta emaresudra dra mali.
uwauwa lla yuyu. an garemay i, kaykuya lla mayaa kanu.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: kayta mellanguya.
aiwa! sallangana ta muka.
kayta malinaya dra mali.
adri a. kayta driya makutra dra tilin.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: emisaus yu lla dra walli?
adri driya. mellallisaw ku dra kaising.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: matimuremur yu lla?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: matimuremur ku lla.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: mellisaw yu lla dra kaising?
ku llisaway lla ku kaising.
daw adri nu sabesabi nu lima?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: ti sabesabay lla an garemay.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: makakuda yu a garemay?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: muka ku mayaa kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: an puludus temakesi i, kakakuda yu?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: papayas ku muruma.
an puludus temakesi i, kakakuda taytaw?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: auka muaraka taytaw.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Lleay, ullaya yu i ruma?
ullaya ku i ruma. usabak i!
Lleay, ullaya yu i ruma?
uniyan i ruma i Lleay. i Irubay ku. a manay nu bangabangan? an muruma i Lleay i, ti rengayaw lla.
S.TRANSL: Lleay不在家耶!我是Irubay，有什麼事嗎？ 回來我會轉告Lleay。
Lleay is not at home. I am Irubay. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: i manay mu?
mumu, i Araytay kay Lleay mi. truwalli driya na alleban!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Araytay和Lleay，幫我們開門！
Grandma, we are Araytay and Lleay, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: i manay?
i Buya ku. maaya ku kane Utay.
S.TRANSL: I am Buya, I am here for Utay.

S.FORM: mumu, druwa ku menauwa kanu.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: paetreng yu lla adri druwa. masupeng ku kanu i!
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你耶！
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Lleay, druwa ku muwadrangiya.
S.TRANSL: Lleay, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: kamelamu usabak i! paetreng ku lla mengangara kanu.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: nanku sinalem na bunga idrini. tallami a!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看！
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: dallau idri na bunga i!
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: alamu driya! nanku sinalem na kalimudan idrini. tallami a!
S.TRANSL: 過來！這是我種的水果，吃看看！
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: dallau idri na kalimudan i!
katengadraw driya. nanku sinalem na kadumu idrini. adri pinuka dra puwatremel. tallami a!
S.TRANSL: 請坐！這是我種的有機玉米吃看看！
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: wa! dalleu idri na kadumu i!
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: aekan yu dra asiru?
adri ku karuwa mekan dra asiru. mekana ku dra linggo.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: aekan yu dra ping-kan?
aiwa. sagar ku mekan.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: kemulitra ku dra kalimudan pakan kanu.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: semangalan! mienay idri na kalimudan i!
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: mabaka ku dra enay patrekel kanu.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: semangalan!
kasadruyu mekan! sadru ku inabelan.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: wa! salaw ullingull aw imaran i!
S.TRANSL: 嗚！ 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: kasadruyu mekan! ullaya driya a sadru kadrini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: adri ku migela a!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: kasadruyu mekan! ullaya driya a sadru kadrini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: sadru lla ku inekanan. adri ku lla pakaekan.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: ku papilangi mu muka i drenan an uninan.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: sadru a samekan i drenan kema i nanalli.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: ku papilangi mu muka i uma an uninan.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: auka ta penitawa?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: auka ta isuwa an uninan?
tu papillangi ta kana sinsi muka i kabalawasan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: auka ta isuwa an uninan?
tu papillangi ta kana sinsi muka i drenan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: auka ta i kabalawasan an uninan?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: adri, tu papillangi ta kana sinsi muka i drenan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: auka ta i drenan an uninan?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: adri, auka ta i uma an uninan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, auka ta i kabalawasan menauwa dra manay?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼？
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: auka ta menauwa dra tiballball.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, auka ta i drenan menauwa dra manay?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼？
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: auka ta menauwa dra aribangllangllawan.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: auka ta kemudaya i uma?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: auka ta menauwa drata sinaleman na kadumu. taranapaw! ullaya a iyabureng, a gerger a!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷！
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinsi, auka ta i kabalawasan mellanguya?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎？
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: adri, auka ta menauwa dra tiballball.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, auka ta i uma semalema dra kulang?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎？
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: auka ta i uma penitawa an uninan.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: ullaya a tiballball a balriibiiyan kadriyu.
amau ku driya nanau dra baabaaw dra tiballball a uninan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: ullaya a aribangllangllawan a balriibiiyan kadriyu.
yē! iuwa a! sagar ku dra aribangllangllawan. salaw bulay!
S.TRANSL: 耶！哇！我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮！
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: ullaya a aribangllangllawan a balriibiiyan kadriyu.
amelli a aribangllangllawan idru. a gerger idru.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: kadru kadri menaunau. adri uwadawill!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷！
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: aiwa, adri mi auka i dawill.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: adri kababekas! patawar kemakawang ane malladu yu!
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: maranger ku palamu menau.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: kemudakuda yu muka i tallabiyaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: mipalidring ku muka i tallabiyaw.
kemudakuda muka i paaisingan taytaw?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: kemakawang muka i paaisingan taytaw.
kemudakuda yu muka i Peng-hu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muisatr ku dra hikuki muka i Peng-hu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: kemudakuda yu muka i Peng-hu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muisatr ku dra sasudang muka i Peng-hu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: muisatr yu dra manay muruma?
muisatr ku dra ciē-yun muruma.
muisatr dra manay muka i takesian i Agam?
S.TRANSL: How does Agam go to school?

S.FORM: muisatr dra igiw muka i takesian i Agam.
S.TRANSL: Agam goes to school by train.

S.FORM: muisatr dra manay muka i kiyukay i Kiring?
S.TRANSL: How does Kiring go to church?

S.FORM: midinsiya muka i kiyukay i Kiring.
S.TRANSL: Kiring goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: muisatr yu dra ciē-yun muka i takesian?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: adri, muisatr ku dra bas muka i takesian.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: midinsiya yu muka i takesian?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: aiwa, midinsiya ku muka i takesian.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: muisatr yu kana pakesup na igiw muka i Takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: aiwa, muisatr ku kana pakesup na igiw muka i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: muisatr yu dra igiw? adri i, dra hikuki muka i Balangaw?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機？
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: muisatr ku dra hikuki. maraarei dra igiw na hikuki.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: muisatr yu dra bas? adri i, mipalidring yu muka i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車？
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: mipalidring ku muka i kiyukay. marakalleayan dra bas an mipalidring ta.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: adallep i supemarekit mu ruma?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: adri adallep. miutubay ku muka i supemarekit.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: adallep i takesian na iyu-ci?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: adallep. kemakawang ta muka.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: adallep i siyataw na aekaekanan?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: mupatraran ta i siyataw aw kemakawang ta dra lluwatra trektrek i, meredek ta lla.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: miwari yu an uninan?
makuda amaw?
maranger ku muka kirepanauwa kanu.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ullaya ku bangabangan aw uniyan ku i ruma an uninan. mayaa ta driya dra druma dra wari i!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧！
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: kaullallaya nu wari an daman? an paelipas dra karealliyan i, kaykuya mayaa kanu.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎？我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: aiwa. ti ngarayaw yu i ruma.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: kiyumalla ku driya, karuwa ku lu-in? maranger ku temilill benilin.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎？我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: aiwa i! inaba kemadru!
karuwa ku lu-ing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: adri ku bulay. aw adri niriwak i kubaw. aeman a!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦！
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: ane kemadru i, semiyasiyasing ku lla.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: adri siyasing.
karuwa ku lla kiyumall kanu. semangalan!
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: aiwa. kiyaumall yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: kiyumala ku driya. a llallak yu driya i, kiyakarun yu dra manay?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的？
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: asuwa driya i, a kinsas ku. meretra ku lla garam.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: mikiyakarunan yu driya garem?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: kiyakarun ku i takesian.
kaadru i drekall nu wallak?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎？
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: adri, kaadru i tukay ku wallak.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: misasa yu kikadru garem?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: benaaw ku dra suwan dra saya. aw dra ayam dra saya. nanku trau i sabak nadru.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: kuyku driya. benaaw ku dra ngiyaw dra saya. ullaya ta kiyarepaillangan a garamgaman i, adri ta lla sallengseng.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: maranger ku kiyumall kanu dratu llegiyan dra paallupan.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: adri sadru ku kinalladraman. ti tubangaw yu kananku kinasaiguwan i!
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: nanemu sinadaday dra paallupan i, ullaya tu llegiyan?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎？
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: naniyam sinadaday dra paallupan i, adri karuwa semegiw a babayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: karuwa kurenang muka paallupa a babayan?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎？
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: adri! adri karuwa muka paallupa a babayan.
S.TRANSL: 不行！女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Kusiyang, uniyan lla dra eraw kanta. uwa driya trima dra eraw!
S.TRANSL: Kusiyang，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kusiyang, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ullaya driya a sadalillan i sawka. aeman na tremima i!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧！
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: sangeut na sadalillan. uwa driya trima dra druwaya dalill.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra eraw. menaniwan mu dra eraw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎？
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: ullaya a! tratrima yu dra munuma?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra druwaya dalill. aw tratrima ku driya dra salubukan dra beras.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: ullaya kadrini na beras. kiyaami yu driya dra manay?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima ku driya dra bitrenun. ullaya?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: niwananay lla peniya na bitrenun.
tratrima ku dra kiruwan.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: maranger yu tremima kana kemudakuda na kiruwan?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: tratrima ku kana lliketri tu asell na kiruwan.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: inaba idrini na midrarang?
ullaya driya a druma tu edad?
ullaya driya a bulenan aw a tremangiya.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: berayi ku dra saya kana tremangiya na kiruwan!
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Kusiyang, muka yu isuwa a garemay? muka yu merenarenadra?
S.TRANSL: Kusiyang你剛剛去哪裡了？你去運動嗎？
Kusiyang, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: adri a! muka ku pullanga kan emu na babayan tremimaa dra kulang.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: a kemadri! piyawari yu an karaub? kuwarenang yu kanku muka mekana?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊！你晚上有沒有空？要不要和我一起吃飯？
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: adri ku pakaauka! auka ku tremimaa dra kiruwan.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: an kemadru i, kurenanga ku kanu muka i!
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: inabayan! kiyumalla ku driya. munuma paisu idri na satenges na kulang?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢？
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: makabetraan paisu na satenges na kulang.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: munuma paisu idri na bunga?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: makatelun paisu na satintin na bunga.
berayi ku dra druwaya tenges dra kulang aw dra satintin dra bunga.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Kiyama, abalu ku kemasu dra tratruri. karuwa yu pabulas kanku?
S.TRANSL: Kiyama，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎？
Kiyama, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: uniyan nanku. nantaw kan Panay idrini.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

S.FORM: karuwa yu pabulas kanku dra palamu? an garemay i, ti parebeliyasanay lla kanu.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎？我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: aiwa. alaku!
semangalan! semangalan kayu lla i Panay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: kiyaami yu dra manay?
parebabeliyas ku kandri na druwaya etib na tilin.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: aiwa. a manay driya nu kiyaamiyan?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: kiyabulas ku driya kanadri na tuluwa etib na tilin.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: inaba lla. an pukatelu wariyan i, adri kaabalu druwa parebeliyasa.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: adri driya nu parebeliyasan kanku na iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku parebeliyasan lla a daman.
daw uniyan ku iyasaus?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了？
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: nu pabulasnay kan Kiyama nay?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Kiyama?

S.FORM: maulid ku i! kayku driya kiyumalla kantaw.
S.TRANSL: 我不知道耶！我去問問她。
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: ti pabulasay yu driya kananku iyasaus.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Panay, tu pinabulasan kan Kiyama idri na patratreell kanu?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did Kiyama lend you this coat?

S.FORM: amelli, tu trinimaan kan nanalli idrini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mararisan kantu patratreell kan Kiyama.
S.TRANSL: Kiyama’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: a udreudrem tu patratreelr. adri marisan naniyam edad.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Panay, kibulas yu dra paisu kan Kiyama?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did you borrow money from Kiyama?

S.FORM: aiwa. panaan i, parebabeliyas ku kantaw garem kema ku i, abalu ku kemasu dra paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: an asuwa i, nu parebabeliyasan lla?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: an daman i, ku parebabeliyasan kantaw lla.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: aiwa. ti rengayaw lla i Kiyama.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Kiyama for you.

S.FORM: na kulabaw i, ta petriray kana petrir na tratreellan dra barasa. na tikuras i, ta petriray kana petrir na sawail. an kemadri i, penauwa.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: aiwa. a kemadrini. pamelli ku i! driyama, adri ku miyatiyu.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ti paladamaw yu kemudakuda ta demaway kandri na druwaya na petrir.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: wa dra inaba i! an kemadrini i likudran i, piyatiyu ku lla dra rawa.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: asatr lla dradru na tralun i uma. uwa alaku na kawkaw i kubaw. kayta i uma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: niretra isuwa na kawkaw?
ullaya kana kamuu i saninin. an musabak yu i kubaw i, nanau yu.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: taranapaw an demikes yu! adri kababuli! salaw idangan na kawkaw.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿！不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: adri dadeelli ku petrir!
ullaya isuwa nu petrir?
ullaya kana kawi i makadare ku petrir.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: daw adri yu abalu?
ku pudrungay kadrini. aw malladram ku dra ullaya isuwa ku petrir.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: a buebu idri. ta retraanay i inayan kiyakuraw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: kaniyam kadriyu i, uniyan mi dra buebu. mipangasipan mi pangasip dra kuraw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: adri ku driya temallam mipangasipan. an masall lla i, paladamu ku maw?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎？
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: aiwa i! an masall lla i, sallangana ta muka pangasipa.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: an masall lla i, ti paladamaw yu demaway dra buebu.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: magingaging nu pangasipan. alla mutiyu a kuraw maku! kamelamui kemedreng!
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了！你快拉起來！
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: kadranga driya! magiyangaging na tamina. kadruwa ku kadri kemedreng kana pangasipan. uwa kadriyu alakan ku dra tabukull.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: kedrengu kanku kadri na kuraw! ti pullangay yu kemedreng.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊！我幫你拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: iuwa dra inaba i! sadru ta kuraw. matemuy ta karisis.
S.TRANSL: 太好了！今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: kamelamuwa ta muruma aw pasiyawa ta dra nirumaenan.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: maylralra na sinsi.
adri kalalinay lra! kamelamu uwa katengadraw kanu katatengadrawan!
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了！快坐在座位上！
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: igelayan! puwari ku lra.
kamelamu usabak!
karesasama na wari garem kana saliyusan?
liyusan lima kana saliyusan garem, sasede ta an daman, salrangana ta muka malinaya!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧！
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: aiwa i! kayta i kabalawasan.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: karesasama na wari an daman kana saliyusan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: liyusan telu kana saliyusan an daman, an paelipas dra karealriyan an daman i kayta malinaya dra mali!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧！
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: kakakuda yu an daman dra semaluwan?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: kasedean dra saliyusan an daman, pararenang mi kan nanalri muka i kiyukay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: kudrama yu?
delalu ku, auka ku i puwatraiyan.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: malupaw ku.
pikakupu temalaulep.
sinsi, nana ku tiyalr, auka ku i puwatraiyan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: aiwa, kamelamu muka!
karuwa ku muka semabesaba dra lima?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: adalrep ta lra temalaulep temakesi, uwa lra an garemay.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, nana ku tranguru, sasede ku an paelipas dra karealriyan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: aiwa, an uwaruma yu i taranapaw i dalan!
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, an masalr dra liyusan sa i sasede ku, auka ku kinauwa dra ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: aiwa, kasalikesiku nu dradrek!
ulraya isuwa i Muya?
nana tu tiyalr, ulraya i puwatraiyan.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: ulraya isuwa i Kunas?
sinsi, nana tu takulaw kan Kunas, semede garem.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kunas has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: daw adri druwa i Muya?
bias tu dradrek.
rengay driya dra i manay kakuwa ta kanu.
i Uking Tatiyam ku ngalad, muketrep ku ami garem.
S.TRANSL: 我叫 Uking Tatiyam，我今年10歲。
My name is Uking Tatiyam, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: i manay nu ngalad?
i Uking Tatiyam ku ngalad.
a walrak yu kana isuwa na maunan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: a walrak ku dra Pinuyumayan.
a Inanuwayan peniya mu trau i sabak?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎？
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: aiwa, a Pinuyumayan mi sarumaenan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是卑南族人。
Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.

S.FORM: a Inanuwayan peniya mu trau i sabak?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎？
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: amelri, a Pinuyumayan i namalri, a Pairang i nanalri.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是卑南族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: tu walrak yu kan manay?
tu walrak ku kan Sakay Tatiyam.
i temama idriyu? munuma lra tu ami?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎？他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: makanemen lra tu ami.
i temama idriyu? munuma lra tu ami?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: amelri, naniyam maaidrangan i drekalr taytaw, makawalu lra tu ami.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: munuma lra tu ami kan bau na mainayan?
muketrep misama dra waluwa tu ami kan baelri na mainayan.
maramaidrang kanu dra sadru i bau na mainayan?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎？
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: kasedean mi dra lruwatra ami.
munuma nu ikaasatr?
saleman misama dra makapetelr sekiyan ku ikaasatr.
paetreng ta lra adri marepanau, asatr yu lra?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了？
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: aiwa a! saleman miasma dra makatelun sekiyan ku ikaasatr.
ulane yu lra?
adri, pamelri nu ninauwan!
idriidriwan yu lra?
adri, ulane ku lra.
ulane yu lra?
aiwa, makatelun kilo ku lra garem.
auka yu isuwa?
auka ku i pan-kung-se mayaa kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: auka isuwa i Kusiyang?
auka matelra dra ubeubel taytaw.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ulraya isuwa i Kusiyang?
ulraya kana danaw dra lralranguyan, auka kurenanga kana marepaukauka dra melranguy an garemay.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ulraya isuwa i Nawinaw? auka kana maariari dra kabekas an garemay taytaw.
S.TRANSL: Nawinaw在哪裡？她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Nawinaw? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ulraya kana uwakasayan maradruk, kayku mayaa kantaw.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: salrangana ta muka i renarenadran i!
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: kayku driya tremimaa dra karealriyan, an garemay i muka ku lra mayaa kanu.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: marenanga ta muka madrasa kana tabutabu i!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: uwa aya dra druma dra trau, auka ku mayaa kana sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: i Isaw i auka kurenanga kana merepaukauka dra kurukēt an uninan?
S.TRANSL: Is Isawco mpeting in croquet today?

S.FORM: adri, auka kurenanga kana merepaukauka dra paselekaw dratu ikaasatr.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: an marepaukauka dra rarenadran kana wari i kuwarenang yu dra marepaukauka?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎？
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: aiwa i! auka ku kurenanga kana maariari dra kabekas.
an marepaukauka dra rarenadran kana wari i kuwarenang yu dra marepaukauka?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎？
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: auka ku kurenanga kana merepaukauka dra kurukēt.
an marepaukauka dra rarenadran kandru na wari i kakakuda ta?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼？
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: auka ta kurenanga kana merepaukauka dra makedrekedreng dra tuwasu.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: naniwan ta dra aekanan an marepaukauka dra rarenadran?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎？
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: adri, naniwan ta dra tabululr.
mualak yu dra asanga! makeser yu i!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶！真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: semangalan!
ulraya i emu na babayan i ruma?
ulraya, ulraya i kiyaedrengan alrupe.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ulraya i emu na babayan i ruma?
uniyan, mupatraran a garemay. uwaruma an aremeng lra.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ulraya i emu na mainayan i ruma?
ulraya kana pukadruwa tadrar. uwa ayau i makasatr.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧！
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ulraya a trau i ruma?
i Minuru a! paetreng ku lra adri menau kanu. inaba yu driya?
S.TRANSL: 是Minuru啊！很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎？
It’s Minuru. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: aiwa! inaba ku driya! druwa ku mayaa kanu madradrayara.
S.TRANSL: 是啊！我很好！我來找你聊天。
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: ulraya isuwa i temama?
ulraya i sawka meriyangering dra irupan. kayku rengayaw i namalri.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫(告訴)爸爸。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: muka isuwa i Tiwa?
muka i puwaterekukan dremimutra dra terekuk.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: emu, druwa mi lra.
uniyan i temuu na mainayan. muka i uma. ngarayu driya i ruma i!
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他去田裡，你們在家等他吧！
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: ina, druwa yu lra!
paetreng ta lra adri menau kanu. asatr yu lra.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: salaw ta semangal dranu iyadruwa!
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: a baberay kanemu idri na pangudralr. retraan i palralritekan.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: paetreng yu lra adri druwa. mukasaya ta mekan i!
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，跟大家一起來吃飯吧！
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: adri kabangabang. tremekela ku dra kulisapa. kayta i kalawalawayan madradrayara.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: semangalan dramu iyalubis. uwaburek ku lra.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你們的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: a trinuwak a garemay idri na terekuk. kasuyu muruma! patawari lra mekan.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: an paelipas dra karealriyan an daman i, marepanauwa ta maw?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎？
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: aiwa, marepanau ta isuwa?
marepanauwa ta i takesian i? aru lalu-ing ta.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎？我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: inaba an muka ta i palakuwan. piakiruwan ku dra bulretrenganan muka.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: an miaputr na sakura kaniyam drekalr i, salaw bulay! an mubaba lra i, alamu lra kaniyam!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來我家吧！
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: ngangara ku palru dra kaseberan lra. paetreng lra dradru!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚(久)了吧！
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: an mangayaw i, alamu lra i!
S.TRANSL: 那你大獵祭(年底祭儀)的時候來吧！
Then come during our The hunting festival!

S.FORM: aiwa i! kiyalrimana ku!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kiyumalra ku driya, daw muasalr yu muruma i drekalr?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活？
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: uwaruma ku patakesi.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: daw adri yu kadru i sinki patakesi?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: masupeng ku i kadrekalran. aw maranger ku pasuba dra drekalr.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: saigu yu temenun. i manay na paladam kanu?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的？
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: i mulri na babayan na paladam. i mulri na babayan i, amau na marasaiguigu temenun kaniyam drekalr.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶教的，奶奶是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: daw maranger yu meladaladam temenun?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: naniyam kakuwayanan na temenun. maranger ku tremungutrungulr dra kakuwayanan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: salaw dalreu an tremekel ta kandri na dinuliyan i!
kuyku na temueraw!
saigu yu i! paetreng an temueraw ta dar?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害！這要釀很久嗎？
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: adri, kararuwa dra saliyusan. maruwa ta lra emabak dra dalilr tremekel. ta tauraw driya demeru na drinereman na driketran. an maderu lra ta palritekay na bineraberas. amerasay dra saima dra enay aw paredraulaw dra pikkak. abakaw kana gulrigulriyan aw retraanay kana mubekebek.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就可以裝瓶喝了呢！把浸泡過的糯米蒸熟後放冷，撒下少許的冷開水將糯米飯攪和開來，再加入酒麴攪拌均勻後裝入甕裡，然後靜置在隱密不通風的地方。

No, it only takes about a week. Steam the soaked glutinous rice and let it cool. Sprinkle a little cold water over the rice to mix it up, then add the koji (rice malt) to the rice, stir it well, and pack it into an urn.

S.FORM: menaniwan yu dra manamanay?
ulraya a kamangulr aw a lugiw kadrini. nanku sinalem peniya a!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔！
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: trimaay a temaradruwa i, munuma paisu?
mukasakasa i, druwaya leman miasma dra makalruwatr paisu.
sagar ku kandri na kiruwan. munuma paisu?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢？
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: lruwatra leman paisu idri.
padrangal lra dradru. legetru driya dra saima i?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: adri karuwa. an ta legetray i, kasasipun ku.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: kuwadruyaw lra i! tratrima ku dra udreudrem dra kiruwan dra saya.
S.TRANSL: 好吧！那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tratrima ku kandri na kamutr aw kandri na bulrawan.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mukasakasa i, druwaya kudrulr paisu. amau ku nilimayan demaway nadri. kapaaetreng an pamanay yu.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ti pakalradramay ku anaanayan druwa tremimaa. karuwa kemadulu driya?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎？
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: aiwa i! ta legetray dra saima.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: alamu nau a! menaniwan ku dra kiruwaruwan lra, dra kabukabung lra.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔！衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: kiyumalra ku driya, na kiruwan i, munuma paisu?
na saya i, tuluwa leman miasma dra makalruwatr paisu. an tuluwa i, sakudrulr paisu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tratrima ku dra saya dra kiruwan. berayi ku kana bekalan.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: inabayan! maranger ku tremima dra bineraberas aw na patraka na tinenger dra makaw.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: uniyan lra na bineraberas. ulraya na pinadrelretr dra tana. tratrima yu?
S.TRANSL: 糯米飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎？
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: aiwa i! berayi ku dra saya. an masalr lra i, druwa ku lra tremimaa dra bineraberas.
S.TRANSL: 好吧！請給我一份，我下次再來買糯米飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: aiwa, ti abakaw driya dra abakan. kemadri i, makalruwatr paisu.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
